channel.title: Runescape Sub-Forum
channel.description:
Currently the Runescape Discussion forum is one of the most heavily populated ones on our forum. Since the removal of all bot software from the game we have all taken a social turn towards the game and frequent events are held amongst the players of Moparscape in response to this. Yet the single section restricts any form of order in the mess of threads that pass through the section day by day turning the section into a complete cluster fuck of different topics loading on top of one another.
So why not create a seperate forum? Yes I understand that the terms of service explicitly say that anyone agreeing does not currently play Runescape, this has been questioned many times and usually resolved with 'just because we discuss the game doesn't mean we play it.' We have a forum for Minecraft, we have a forum for Android Applications and we have a forum for Game Development, so why not Runescape?
In terms of the contents of the forum itself I have had a few ideas. The sections of the forum could incorporate all aspects of the game including social gatherings to in-game guides and tutorials. Sections could inclue:
[ul][li]Tutorials/Guides[/li] [li]Clans[/li] [li]Game Discussion[/li] [li]Community Based Events[/li] [li]Help/General Questions[/li] [li]Account Show-off/Progress Threads[/li] [li]Personal/Group Achievments[/li] [li]Market Place[/li] [li]Updates Discussion[/li][/ul]
Note I have barely scratched the surface on what could be in the forum but if you have any suggestions, feel free to post below and I might add them to the list. I will not be making a supporters list but if you wish to leave your support you are more than welcome.
Thanks

item.title: Runescape Sub-Forum
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:28, topic:426735”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=529433.msg3864807#msg3864807 date=1324931093]

I got a better idea, just make it allowed for members to make their own sub-domains off MSCP.

If you don’t get the sarcasm, go see a doctor.

Nah imo they should be able to create an entirely new domain that mitb has to pay for in addition to the current websites!

Now that’s a suggestion. +100
[/quote]
I’m glad you see it my way!

So this can be locked now?[/quote]
Yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Sub-Forum
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:3, topic:426735”]You’re forgetting one key detail:

It’s only one of the most popular sections because it’s all in one section. It’s also extremely easy to post here, not having to log in to any other sites and such, or remember to check yet ANOTHER forum. It’s already a pain keeping up with four.

If you break it all up into a different sections on a different forum, not only will the posts per day about RuneScape die down (once the initial surge of a new forum dies down, that is), but some sections will be left almost dead, and some will be mostly empty except a few popular threads (lets face it, most of the daily action in that section is the Post your character and such)[/quote]
create sub-forums of the sub-forum!

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Sub-Forum
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The RuneScape board doesn’t receive nearly enough activity to warrant an entire subforum. The existing subforums exist for organizational reasons, minus this one and gamedev. MoparScape existed because it developed into an entirely separate community, and gamedev exists for a new direction for the site.

I think the community is already stretched thin in terms of subforums. So, for now, I can’t see it being worth it.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Sub-Forum
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:5, topic:426735”]@Davidi2

In all honesty, the Android forum is extremely inactive and the Minecraft forum will be lucky to reach 5-10 posts per day. I would be highly surprised if the amount of Runescape related posts died down if it was to open as the amount of players returning to Runescape is rising each day and many seek guidance and such which is where you will see alot of questions popping up in the Post your Character thread. As to dead sections, it is inevitable that some will be much less populated than others however if that is a serious concern some sections could incorporate more than one aspect (ie. clans and community events could be placed into one).[/quote]The forums I were talking about were Moparscape, Mopar Game Dev, Moparisthebest, and MoparCraft. And while yes MGD and MC aren’t as active, I still check them. Android never gets and posts so I don’t check it

Read full topic

In all honesty, the Android forum is extremely inactive and the Minecraft forum will be lucky to reach 5-10 posts per day. I would be highly surprised if the amount of Runescape related posts died down if it was to open as the amount of players returning to Runescape is rising each day and many seek guidance and such which is where you will see alot of questions popping up in the Post your Character thread. As to dead sections, it is inevitable that some will be much less populated than others however if that is a serious concern some sections could incorporate more than one aspect (ie. clans and community events could be placed into one).[/quote]
More and more players are leaving Runescape, and joining private servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Sub-Forum
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

@ox random xi

I am fully aware of the threads in the section and yes you present a valid point that this is a private server community. However as I said, the threads are clustered into one section with little to no order and the most posted on thread in the section is filled with so much off-topic rubbish that it is hard to actually see the real posts (however I have seen an improvement lately so please don’t correct me). Also you say that this is a private server community yet we have a forum dedicated to Minecraft which is quite a bit less popular with members here than Runescape

@Davidi2

In all honesty, the Android forum is extremely inactive and the Minecraft forum will be lucky to reach 5-10 posts per day. I would be highly surprised if the amount of Runescape related posts died down if it was to open as the amount of players returning to Runescape is rising each day and many seek guidance and such which is where you will see alot of questions popping up in the Post your Character thread. As to dead sections, it is inevitable that some will be much less populated than others however if that is a serious concern some sections could incorporate more than one aspect (ie. clans and community events could be placed into one).

Read full topic
